Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a form of censorship that threatens freedom of speech.
The proposed legislation is compared to dictatorial practices, drawing parallels with alleged suppression of information in the United States.
There is a belief that the legislation is part of a broader global trend towards authoritarianism and control over information.
Concerns are raised about the potential for the legislation to be used to suppress political dissent and manipulate elections.
The submission argues that the legislation could lead to a loss of national sovereignty, particularly if powers are handed over to international bodies like the WHO.
Notable Quotes: This Orwellian takeover of a free country by stealth must stop forthwith!
I want protection from the excesses and political crimes of a powerful government, not to live under a dictatorship that claims to be protecting me from the truth or subjectively defined falsehoods.
The people of the World will rise against the WHO and the politicians who have given away our national sovereignty.
